intro: Hieracium symplectum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and occur in dense clusters, giving the plant its common name. Hieracium symplectum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
